relevant_findings.description: Document about Osvaldo Relova, a Cuban Intelligence officer with potential indirect connection to Oswald
relevant_findings.direct_quote: A former Cuban IS officer who served with the Cuban Intelligence Service until April 1964
relevant_findings.significance: Provides context about Cuban intelligence personnel active around the time of the assassination

relevant_findings.description: Detailed travel records for Osvaldo Relova
relevant_findings.direct_quote: An airline passenger manifest revealed that one Osvaldo RELOVA Pelicent, probably identical with the above Subject, left Mexico for Habana on 8 July 1963 and was the holder of Cuban passport number D/63/415
relevant_findings.significance: Demonstrates detailed tracking of intelligence-related personnel's movements

relevant_findings.direct_quote: RELOVA, pseudonym 'Wilberto', is an officer of the Direccion General de Inteligencia (General Directorate of Intelligence - DGI) in Cuba
relevant_findings.significance: Provides insight into Cuban intelligence structure during the early 1960s

relevant_findings.description: Detailed information about Osvaldo RELOVA, a Cuban Embassy official connected to Oswald's activities
relevant_findings.direct_quote: Osvaldo RELOVA, First Secretary of the Cuban Embassy in Canada, left Kingston for Toronto on 21 October 1963, on TCA flight number 885.
relevant_findings.significance: Provides context about Cuban diplomatic personnel active around the time of the assassination

relevant_findings.description: Details of Osvaldo RELOVA's travel and diplomatic movements
relevant_findings.direct_quote: RELOVA was an administrator of a section of the Consolidated Hardware Stores and annexes. In late 1961 he went to see source to get help with an investigation on a Mr. BARRAL.
relevant_findings.significance: Reveals Relova's professional background and potential intelligence-related activities

relevant_findings.description: Information about Cuban diplomatic personnel in Canada
relevant_findings.direct_quote: An official Canadian source reported that Osvaldo RELOVA, born on 13 August 1930, was not the First Secretary of the Cuban Embassy in Canada as previously reports stated.
relevant_findings.significance: Suggests potential discrepancies in diplomatic personnel information
